title: TCS reports dip in Q4 hiring, full-year attrition cools to 12.5%
description: For TCS, the headcount decreased by 1,759 since the last quarter, ending the fiscal year at a headcount of 601,546. In the third quarter, TCS had reported a sequential headcount dip of 5,680.
content: Indiaâ€™s largest IT major Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) reported a dip on the hiring front in the fiscal fourth quarter. The company saw headcount decrease by 1,759 since the last quarter, ending the fiscal year at a headcount of 601,546. In the third quarter, TCS had reported a sequential headcount dip of 5,680. The firm, however, ended FY24 with 13,249 fewer employees compared to FY23, even as revenue grew 3.5% on-year.Increments of 4.5-7%, depending on performance, were rolled out for all employees starting in April, said Milind Lakkad, chief HR officer of TCS. Lakkad added that high-performers will get double digit hikes. The company expects to meet its usual fresher hiring target of about 40,000 for the year, Lakkad said.
